thread.title: RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Suspect arrested in Tuesday memorial service shooting
thread.title_full: RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Suspect arrested in Tuesday memorial service shooting - Press Enterprise

author: ALI TADAYON
title: RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Suspect arrested in Tuesday memorial service shooting
text:
BY ALI TADAYON / STAFF WRITER
Published: Oct. 1, 2015 Updated: 7:41 a.m. RANCHO CUCAMONGA: Suspect arrested in Tuesday memorial service shooting Print Photo Share Pin It More Galleries ADVERTISEMENT People console each other at the scene of a fatal shooting in the Sixth Street Industrial Park in Rancho Cucamonga on Wednesday, Sept. 30 2015. Deputies responded to a shots fired call on Tuesday night in the 10000 block of Sixth Street and found a male suffering from gun shot wounds. He was transported to a hospital and died from his injuries. STAN LIM, STAFF PHOTOGRAPHER Related article Â» San Bernardino County Sheriff's deputies on Thursday, Oct. 1, arrested a San Bernardino man on suspicion of shooting a man to death Tuesday in Rancho Cucamonga.
Andre Taylor, 46, was booked into Rancho Cucamonga's West Valley Detention Center Thursday on suspicion of committing murder, according to a Sheriff's Department news release. His bond is set at $1 million.
Kevin Hill, 46, was shot and killed Tuesday night while attending a memorial service for a fellow member of a motorcycle club, Sheriff's Department officials said.
After deputies responded the 10000 block of 6th Street near Hermosa Avenue about 10:40 p.m., Hill was taken to a hospital, where he died.
The suspect remained at large after the shooting. But after an investigation by the Sheriff's Department's Specialized Enforcement Division, deputies located and arrested Taylor at a motel in Ontario.
